sections.title: READING
sections.passage: The concept of 'fast fashion'—inexpensive clothing produced rapidly by mass-market retailers in response to the latest trends—has dramatically changed the fashion industry and our shopping habits. While it makes trendy clothing accessible to more people, it comes at a significant environmental and social cost. The production process often involves high water consumption, toxic dyes, and synthetic fabrics that do not biodegrade. This leads to vast amounts of textile waste, as garments are often worn only a few times before being discarded. Furthermore, to keep prices low, production is often outsourced to countries with lax labor regulations, leading to poor working conditions and low wages for garment workers. Consumers are becoming more aware of these issues and are starting to seek out more sustainable alternatives, such as buying second-hand, choosing clothes made from eco-friendly materials, and supporting brands that are transparent about their supply chains. The shift towards 'slow fashion' encourages buying fewer items of higher quality that will last longer.

questions.question: What is the main topic of the passage?
options: The economic benefits of the fashion industry
The negative impacts of fast fashion and the trend towards sustainability

questions.question: Which of these is mentioned as an environmental problem with fast fashion?
options: High water usage and textile waste
It only uses natural, biodegradable fabrics

questions.question: The passage suggests that fast fashion garments are typically high quality and long-lasting.
What is 'slow fashion' presented as?
options: A more sustainable and conscious way of consuming fashion
A more expensive version of fast fashion

questions.question: According to the text, consumers are completely unaware of the problems with fast fashion.

parts.instructions: Read this article and for each question circle the correct letter A, B, C, D. Only one answer is possible.
parts.text: Online learning has become extremely popular. It offers great flexibility, but it requires a lot of self-discipline. Students must be motivated to keep up (6) ______ the coursework. Many courses use video lectures, which students can watch (7) ______ their own pace. (8) ______ the convenience, some students miss the social interaction of a traditional classroom. It is important to choose a platform that provides good support (9) ______ its students. (10) ______, online education is a powerful tool for lifelong learning when used effectively.

questions.question: 6. A with B to C from D on
7. A in B on C at D by
8. A Despite B Although C Because D So
9. A for B to C with D about
10. A Overall B However C Therefore D Instead

parts.instructions: Put the verbs given in brackets into the correct forms

questions.question: 11. If she _________________ (study) harder, she would have passed the exam.
12. They _________________ (watch) a movie when the power went out.
13. The missing painting _________________ (find) by a tourist last month.
14. 'The phone is ringing.' 'I _________________ (get) it!'
15. He _________________ (not finish) his homework yet.

parts.instructions: Read the text and use the words in CAPITALS to form a word which fits into the gap in the same line.
parts.text: Starting a business requires careful (16) ........................ . You need a lot of (17) ........................ to succeed. It's not always easy, and you will face many (18) ........................ . However, the feeling of (19) ........................ is very rewarding. Being a successful (20) ........................ is a dream for many.

questions.question: (19) ........................ is very rewarding (ACHIEVE)
(20) ........................ is a dream for many (ENTREPRENEUR)

sections.title: WRITING
sections.instructions: Read the follow-up email and fill each space with one word only.
sections.text:
Subject: Following up on our meeting

Dear John,

I am writing to follow (21).................... on our conversation from last week. It was a pleasure to meet with you and discuss the project. As we discussed, I have attached the proposal for your review.

Please let me know if you have any questions. I look forward to hearing (22).................... you soon.

We are very excited (23).................... the possibility of working together. Please send your feedback (24).................... the end of the week.

Thank you (25).................... your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Sarah

questions.question: I am writing to follow (21).................... on our conversation
I look forward to hearing (22).................... you soon
We are very excited (23).................... the possibility of working together
Please send your feedback (24).................... the end of the week
Thank you (25).................... your time and consideration
